definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: One day he showed his friend a love poem he had written to Maria.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他把寫給瑪利亞的一首愛情詩拿給朋友看。

sentences.english: Jiu Ge is a group of lyric poetry with a novel way of composition.
sentences.chinese: 《九歌》是一組體制獨特的抒情詩。

sentences.english: He likes to write amatory poem to the lady he loves.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡給自己所愛的女孩寫情詩。

sentences.english: Small qian incarnation book fairy meet, hand to tear to refuse his love poem.
sentences.chinese: 小倩化身簿仙子相見，一手將情詩撕毀拒絕他的情意。

sentences.english: This is a good example of his lyric poetry.
sentences.chinese: 這首詩是他抒情詩的範例。

sentences.english: The lyrics of Shakespeare exalted the audience.
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亞的抒情詩激發了聽衆的想像力。

sentences.english: Nine years and not a single love poem written.
sentences.chinese: 九年了，沒有一首情詩寫成功過。

sentences.english: Here nice book about Love Poems & Love Letters for your references.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有關於愛情詩及情書的好書可爲你參考。

sentences.english: Snow Lai another lyric poetry has the feeling of the imagination and beautiful of brilliancy with the result that.
sentences.chinese: 雪萊另一類抒情詩具有輝煌的想象和優美的情致。

sentences.english: The flourish of poems of love is a special phenomenon of literature in the circle of poets of the late Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 愛情詩的興盛是中晚唐詩壇一個引人注目的文學現象。

sentences.english: I thought about writing her a love poem and proposing in the poem.
sentences.chinese: 我曾想過給她寫一個情詩，在詩中向她求婚。

sentences.english: Shuting's love poetry is significant works in the history of Chinese love poetry.
sentences.chinese: 舒婷的愛情詩是中國愛情詩史上不可或缺的力作。

sentences.english: Star-hyun in his diary painted a portrait of Helen, to write poems.
sentences.chinese: 星鉉在自己的日記本里繪美玲的肖像，寫情詩。

sentences.english: Alden Soup boiled with lima beans looks like a lyric for autumn.
sentences.chinese: 用青豆熬成的愛爾登湯，有如一篇科天的抒情詩。

sentences.english: A glance can be a dangerous thing in the world of Latin lyric poetry.
sentences.chinese: 在拉丁文的抒情詩中，無意的一瞥可能是危險的。

definition: saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
to not say a word (idiom)/to keep silent
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
thousands of words (idiom); having a lot of things to say/talking nonstop
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
